body:
Comment 4 by **brady**: 
Fair enough that other languages do not have goto.

Generally I think the confusion is created because its called "else" and it seems many
people do not attach to the concept of a for loop being nothing really more than a
if/goto logical construct. Perhaps if it was called something other than "else" it would
make it more obvious? Then again I am pretty sure that adding a keyword is a harder path
than I am already tracking. =)

Generally I find a bunch of places that I would love to have else (given that golang
doesn't have a "in" operator either) since it would in turn make my own code much easier
to follow since the current approach requires moving the condition into the loop
therefor breaking the normal "reading flow". I used this quite a lot in python, and
typically found that people thought it was pretty useful once the saw it used, but I
totally understand if its not included given the contention around it. A misunderstood
feature is often far worse than a missing feature.
